content: Hi, I'm a bit new to contributing to Rust, I have been going through the documentation about contributing and found an issue which looks decent for a beginner, the #90698 was claimed by a user which I don't think is working anymore on it, as such I would like to know if it is alright for me to claim this issue. I've also seen the tag E-mentor but I'm not sure what it means. Thanks for any help on my first contribution to Rust ever.
Hello! In this case, you might add a comment to the issue and tag the assignee saying you're interested in working on it.

E-mentor means there's a contributor with experience in this area willing to help a new contributor with the issue. (In this case, I don't think Joshua is still mentoring issues, since he's taken a step back from the project.)

pierwill said:

E-mentor means there's a contributor with experience in this area willing to help a new contributor with the issue. (In this case, I don't think Joshua is still mentoring issues, since he's taken a step back from the project.)

Hi again, if I have no response from anyone about the issue, when should I consider that I can claim it and try to begin working on it. Also, I would like to know where could I ask for mentorship on this issue or just specific question on getting to work on it.
Probably a few days to a week is enough
You can ask in this current stream (#t-compiler/help)
